instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the models in the related study to estimate electrical conductivity (EC) for soil salinization and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the models was the coefficient of determination (R-2) and the ratio of the performance to deviation (RPD). The R-2 measures the proportion of the variance in the dependent variable (electrical conductivity) that is predictable from the independent variables (reflectance, PCA scores, and derivative). The RPD, on the other hand, assesses the ratio of the standard deviation of the predicted values to the standard deviation of the reference values. 

The R-2 and RPD metrics provide information about the accuracy and precision of the models in estimating electrical conductivity. Higher values of R-2 and RPD indicate better predictive ability and lower values of root mean square error (RMSE), which represents the average difference between the predicted and reference values. 

However, the text does not specify the specific range or threshold for the R-2 and RPD values to determine the extent to which these metrics can go.

instruction: How were the four computational models used in the related study to estimate electrical conductivity (EC) for soil salinization using laboratory reflectance spectroscopy?
Output: In the related study, the four computational models (Extreme Learning Machine (ELM), Ordinary Least Square regression (OLS), Partial Least Squares Regression (PLSR), and Multilayer Perceptron (MLP)) were used to estimate electrical conductivity (EC) for soil salinization using laboratory reflectance spectroscopy. The study evaluated the performance of these models by simulating the spectral resolution of different hyperspectral and multispectral sensors. Three sets of data, namely reflectance, Principal Component Analysis (PCA) scores, and first-order derivative analysis, were used as input variables for the models. The models were then tested and compared based on their predictive ability, as indicated by the coefficient of determination (R-2), ratio of the performance to deviation (RPD), and root mean square error (RMSE). The results showed that the linear models (ELM and OLS) performed better than the MLP model, with higher R-2 and RPD values and lower RMSE values. Additionally, metrics associated with soil brightness (reflectance and PCA scores) were found to be more efficient in detecting changes in EC due to soil salinization compared to metrics related to spectral features (derivative analysis).
